---------------

**Storage Tank System Decommissioning**

** Tender Reference No.**: PW-NCS-204-12308
** Solicitation No.**: ET022-230824/A
** Tender Closing Date / Date de soumissions**: September 20, 2022 at 16:00:00

**Government of Canada Initiative**
The Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC) on behalf of Correctional Service Canada (CSC) is inviting interested contractors to submit bids for the decommissioning of a storage tank system at CSC Regional Psychiatric Centre in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan.

**Project Objective**
The Project objective is to decommission, remove, and dispose of an underground storage tank system with an associated aboveground day tank, and complete associated site restoration works including, but not limited to, a new foundation and re-installation of an exterior steel staircase.

**Site Description**
The subject site is located at CSC Regional Psychiatric Centre, 2520 Central Avenue, Saskatoon, Saskatchewan. The storage tank system is registered with Environment and Climate Change Canada under Identification Number EC-00000135, and consists of two tanks:

* One 5,000 L fiberglass diesel underground storage tank (UST)
* One 675 L diesel day tank

**Project Requirements**

* Completion of and submission of permit applications
* Management of site safety
* Site preparation activities
* UST and day tank system decommissioning and removal
* Environmental sampling
* Restoration of the site
* Submission of project closeout documentation

**Bidder Selection Criteria**
Bidder qualification and financial bid evaluation will be conducted in two phases. The first phase will evaluate the qualifications of all interested suppliers and the second phase will invite the qualified suppliers to provide a financial bid for the project.

**Bidder Mandatory Requirements**

* Bidders must be considered qualified in accordance with the federal Storage Tank Systems for Petroleum Products and Allied Petroleum Products Regulations (SOR/2008-197)
* Bidders must be licensed/certified by Provincial authorities having jurisdiction in the Province of Saskatchewan for removal of underground storage tanks and be a member of the Saskatchewan Retail Petroleum Construction Association and/or the Canadian Petroleum Contractors Association registered in Saskatchewan.

**Tender Documents**
Tender documents including drawings and specifications will be provided to interested qualified contractors upon confirmation of qualifications. The documents may be presented in either official language of Canada.

**Contact Information**
Kae Grewal, Supply Specialist, PSPC, can be contacted for inquiries regarding this tender.
